Definition: A joint dislocation occurs when the ends of the bones are forced out of their normal positions in a joint.
Symptoms: Visible deformity, swelling, pain, and inability to move the joint.
Diagnosis: Physical examination and imaging studies such as X-rays.
Treatment: Reduction (realigning the joint), immobilization, and rehabilitation.

Definition: Joint pain is discomfort, soreness, or pain in any of the body's joints.
Symptoms: Pain, swelling, stiffness, and reduced range of motion.
Diagnosis: Physical examination, medical history, and imaging studies.
Treatment: Pain relievers, physical therapy, and sometimes surgery.

Definition: Juvenile nasopharyngeal angiofibroma is a rare, benign tumor that occurs in the nasopharynx, primarily in adolescent males.
Causes: Exact cause is unknown, but may be related to hormonal factors.
Symptoms: Nasal obstruction, nosebleeds, and facial swelling.
Diagnosis: Imaging studies such as CT or MRI and biopsy.
